decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the Phyrexian Dreadnought combo to quickly win the game. It utilizes various cards to set up the combo, protect it with counterspells, and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion for additional value. The deck also includes cantrips and tutors to find the combo pieces efficiently. It incorporates a mix of control elements and card advantage to ensure consistency in executing the combo while interacting with the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win through a swift and powerful combination of cards.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and card advantage through artifacts such as Mishra's Workshop, Moxen, and Tolarian Academy. It uses cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Grim Monolith to bounce and replay artifacts, drawing additional cards and generating more mana. The deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning combo involving Time Vault and Voltaic Key or activating Karn, the Great Creator's abilities to shut down the opponent's strategies. It utilizes powerful artifacts and efficient card draw to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by playing hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow them down, while also aggressively attacking with creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. The deck also includes disruptive artifacts like Trinisphere and Wasteland to further hinder the opponent's strategy, making it difficult for them to cast spells or develop their board. This aggressive and disruptive strategy aims to control the game and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Chalice of the Void, while utilizing fast mana like Moxen and Ancient Tomb to power out threats quickly. The deck also includes powerful hate cards like Karakas and Trinisphere to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain an advantage in the match.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to rapidly fill the graveyard with cards such as Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp, allowing for powerful graveyard interactions with cards like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, the deck can quickly set up its graveyard and establish a strong board presence. The inclusion of Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul adds additional synergy and inevitability to the deck, creating a potent combo strategy that can overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while deploying aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm them. By playing hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper, along with disruption cards like Trinisphere and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to slow down the opponent and control the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration with Moxen and Ancient Tomb to deploy threats ahead of schedule. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and mana acceleration, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while applying pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper and Chancellor of the Annex, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. It aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing disruptive spells such as Archon of Emeria and Trinisphere, while also having access to powerful mana acceleration through cards like Black Lotus and Moxen. The deck's game plan is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan, leading to a swift victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and disruption while utilizing Oath of Druids as a win condition. By resolving Oath of Druids, the deck can cheat large threats into play and overpower the opponent. The deck includes various powerful artifacts and spells to support this game plan, such as Black Lotus, Ancestral Recall, and Force of Will. Additionally, Boseiju, Who Endures can protect key spells from being countered, ensuring the deck's strategy can be executed successfully. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a victory through powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Oath of Druids card to quickly summon powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand. It also includes a lot of control cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's plans. Additionally, there are cards like Show and Tell and Tinker to cheat out powerful artifacts like Bolas's Citadel and Time Vault. The deck also includes mana acceleration through cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to help ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Phyrexian Dreadnought combo, utilizing cards like Dress Down and Doorkeeper Thrull to cheat it into play. The goal is to use Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to recur key combo pieces and maintain a consistent flow of threats. The deck also includes powerful disruption in the form of Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo and disrupt opposing strategies. The mana base is designed to support the combo while providing access to various colors for flexibility in casting spells.

Utilizing efficient removal spells, powerful card advantage engines, and disruptive counterspells, this Esper Control deck aims to control the game and outvalue its opponent. The deck includes a versatile companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, along with key vintage staples like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Black Lotus. With a strong mana base and a mix of proactive and reactive spells, this deck is well-equipped to handle a variety of threats and establish dominance in the early to mid-game.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with hatebear abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats. By utilizing mana acceleration and disruptive cards like Void Mirror and Chancellor of the Annex, it aims to slow down the opponent's spells and create a board presence that is difficult to deal with. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Clarion Conqueror to maintain resources while pressuring the opponent. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and card advantage, this deck aims to control the game and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to search for and set up a winning condition using cards like Thassa's Oracle. It includes a mix of powerful spells and fast mana acceleration like Black Lotus and Dark Ritual to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. It also includes card draw and selection like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find key combo pieces. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently by effectively executing the Doomsday combo.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 MUD Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void, Null Rod, and Sphere of Resistance while also using powerful artifact creatures like Lodestone Golem and Stonecoil Serpent to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration options like Mishra's Workshop, Ancient Tomb, and the infamous Black Lotus to quickly establish board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. Additionally, Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide additional disruption against opposing lands, further solidifying the deck's aggressive strategy.

The deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Tolarian Academy, Grim Monolith, and Ancient Tomb. This excess mana is then used to cast Paradoxical Outcome, returning key artifacts like Coveted Jewel and The One Ring to hand while drawing cards. The deck also features various artifact tutors like Karn, the Great Creator and Tinker to find combo pieces such as Time Vault and The One Ring. Force of Will and Sink into Stupor provide disruption, ensuring the combo can go off smoothly.

The focus of this deck is on control through spells and card advantage. By utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Gifts Ungiven, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion. The deck also features powerful mana rocks and card draw spells to ensure consistency and flexibility in gameplay. Ultimately, the deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic play.
